posts.post_content:
Posted By: Eric
Does anyone have a N172 card thats been AUTOGRAPHED by the player and encapsulated/authenticated?

I'd be interested in something like this if anyone has one.

Posted By: T206Collector
...pre-1900 autographed baseball cards.  It's from my website:

[url]http://mysite.verizon.net/vzewll4b/t206collector/id28.html[/url]

If you learn about any other cards, please let me know.

Posted By: Eric
Thanks for that link.

Posted By: Rhys
There was a complete set of autographed Warren Studios cabinets from 1872 that was sold through Hunts I believe a few years back.  They are some of the most impressive items items I have ever seen in the hobby.

Rhys

Posted By: rmacpa
the 11 autographed warren cabinets which were offered at auction
in december 2005 (8 by sothebys which were unrestored with
pinholes at the top of each cabinet and 3 by mastro which
were restored to cover the pinholes) comprise a near set
of the images known to exist in the warren cabinet set.
there is a second cabinet version of george wright (leaning on bat)
also known to exist in autographed form. it was autographed
to wright's teammate deacon white and consigned by white's
heirs to hunt auctions along with other significant deacon white
owned items.
